item.title: Risks of Micro and Nonplastic Particles in Water Bottles Largely Exaggerated, Study Finds
item.description: A new study conducted by a team of researchers at the University of New Yorkshire has found that the risks associated with micro and nonplastic particles in water bottles may have been largely exaggerated. The study, which was published in the Journal of Environmental Science, examined the ability of these particles to enter cells and the bloodstream, and found that their ability to do so is limited. Scale for nanoplastics The research was led by Dr.
